intro: Rospidios, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a hairy texture. Rospidios is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
